org.gearvrf

Class GVRTextureParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRTextureParameters

  • public class GVRTextureParameters
extends java.lang.Object
    The class to be used to set and pass texture filter and warp types for loading texture and also to enhance texture even after they are loaded.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  GVRTextureParameters.TextureFilterType
      Enum values for all the filter types along with all its actual values.
      static class  GVRTextureParameters.TextureWrapType
      Enum values for all the wrap types along with all its actual values.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GVRTextureParameters(GVRContext gvrContext)
      Constructs a texture parameter object with default values for filter and warp.

      Returns the anisotropic value that was set by the calling API.

      Returns an integer array that contains the current values for all the texture parameters.

      Returns an integer array that contains the default values for all the texture parameters.

      • setMinFilterType

        public void setMinFilterType(GVRTextureParameters.TextureFilterType minFilterType)
        Sets the MIN filter for texture.
        Parameters:
        minFilterType - Basically, a GL constant that represents the type of filter one want to apply.

      • getMinFilterType

        public GVRTextureParameters.TextureFilterType getMinFilterType()
        Returns the MIN filter of the GVRTextureParameters. The returned value could be the one that was set by the calling API or the default value for all the objects.
        Returns:
        The MIN filter type as a TextureFilterType.

      • isAnisotropicSupported

        public boolean isAnisotropicSupported()
        Returns true or false based on whether anisotropic filtering is supported or not.
        Returns:
        true or false based on whether anisotropic filtering is supported or not.

      • setAnisotropicValue

        public void setAnisotropicValue(int value)
        Sets the anisotropic value. Normally the values that are set is 2, 4, 8 and 16. So if someone tries to set a value which is greater than the max value, 16, the method sets it to the max value. Also the default value for anisotropic filter is 1, which means that it is not applied when it is 1.
        Parameters:
        value - An integer value from the set {2, 4, 8, 16}

      • getAnisotropicValue

        public int getAnisotropicValue()
        Returns the anisotropic value that was set by the calling API.
        Returns:
        the anisotropic value that was set by the calling API.

      • getMaxAnisotropicValue

        public int getMaxAnisotropicValue()
        Returns the maximum anisotropic value.
        Returns:
        the maximum anisotropic value.
